jx.jx_cn_mean: 【计算机】远程访问(通过电话线路或电子链路从本机访问另一计算机的文件或系统)

可以到达；可以使用；有接触(或进入、使用)的机会(或权利)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'sudden attack of illness'): from Latin accessus, from the verb accedere 'to approach' (see accede) Sense 1is first recorded in the early 17th cent

encyclopedia.content: Microsoft Office Access（前名 Microsoft Access）是由微软发布的关联式数据库管理系统。它结合了 Microsoft Jet Database Engine 和 图形用户界面两项特点，是 Microsoft Office的成员之一。其实Access 也是微软公司另一个通讯程序的名字，想与 ProComm 以及其他类似程序来竞争。可是事后微软证实这是个失败计划，并且将它中止。数年后他们把名字重新命名于数据库软件。Access在2000年的时候成为了计算机等级考试中的计算机二级的一种数据库语言并且因为它的易学易用的特点正逐步取代传统的VFP成为二级中最受欢迎的数据库语言。

entry.def: If you have access to a building or other place, you are able or allowed to go into it.

example.ex: The facilities have been adapted to give access to wheelchair users.
example.tran: 这些设施已经改造过以方便轮椅使用者进入。

example.ex: Scientists have only recently been able to gain access to the area...
example.tran: 科学家直到最近才得以进入该地区。

entry.tran: 查阅（或使用）的机会（或权利）
entry.def: If you have access to something such as information or equipment, you have the opportunity or right to see it or use it.

example.ex: ...a Code of Practice that would give patients right of access to their medical records.
example.tran: 允许病人查看自己病历的职业准则

example.ex: ...whether one has access to a dish and the other accoutrements needed to watch satellite TV.
example.tran: 是否能使用碟型卫星天线以及其他观看卫星电视所需要的装备

entry.tran: 接近（或面见）的机会（或权利）
entry.def: If you have access to a person, you have the opportunity or right to see them or meet them.

example.ex: He was not allowed access to a lawyer.
My ex-wife deliberately sabotages my access to the children.
example.tran: 我的前妻蓄意阻挠我见孩子。

entry.def: If you access something, especially information held on a computer, you succeed in finding or obtaining it.

example.ex: You've illegally accessed and misused confidential security files.
example.tran: 你已经非法访问并盗用了机密的安全文件。

stems_affixes.word_buile: access[n.接近;入口 v.存取, 接近]+ible能……的→adj.能接近的;可进去的
access接近+ory表形容词或名词→接近的物→附加物,附属的
excess[n.过度,过剩]+ive……的→adj.过分的;过度的
in不+accessible[adj.能接近的;可进去的]→adj.难以接近的
suc随后+cess行走,前进+ive……的→随后跟上→连续的
access接近+ory表形容词或名词→接近的物→附加物,附属的
an=ante前+cest=cess行走,前进+or人→走在前面的人→祖先
an=ante前+cest=cess行走,前进+ry整体→n.祖先;世系,家世
con共同+cess后退+ion动作或状态→n.让步;退位
ne=need需要+cess行走,前进+ary物→n.必需品

stems_affixes.value_cn: 必要性, 需要,必需品
stems_affixes.word_buile: ne=need需要+cess行走,前进+ity性质,特性等→n.必要性, 需要,必需品
process[n.过程;进行 v.加工, 处理]+ion表名词→向前走的队伍
re回+cess行走,前进→走回去→休息
re回+cess行走,前进+ion动作或状态→走回去→撤退
suc随后+cess行走,前进→随后跟上→继续→继续做→成功

stems_affixes.value_cn: 接连发生,继承, 继任
stems_affixes.word_buile: suc随后+cess行走,前进+ion动作或状态→随后跟上→继续发生→继续别人[事业,成功]→继承, 继任

Sentence.sentence: That means users have access to notes from not only their classmates and Facebook friends, but anyone who purchased the book across the country.

Many policy measures to control obesity（肥胖症）assume that people consciously and rationally choose what and how much they eat and therefore focus on providing information and more access to healthier foods," note the two researchers
Easy access leads to customers' over-consumption.
Migrants to cities are attracted by plentiful jobs, access to hospitals and education, and the ability to escape the boredom of a farmer's agricultural life.
There's a stimulative effect that kicks in when women have greater access to jobs and the economic lives of our countries: Greater political stability
